page.title: 11HEATHERSLAW MILL MUSEUM
page.content: HEATHERSLAW MILL MUSEUM The flour mill at Heatherslaw was one of a number of water mills which were working on the banks of the River Till near Heatherslaw at the beginning of this century.About 8 years ago a Trust was formed to restore the mill to working order.The village joiner made a new wheel and the three-storied double mill has been fully restored.A complete set of machinery and ancillary gear is in working order,well documented and backed up by photographs and mementoes of its past.The mill sells the flour it grinds and it will also grind wheat for local farmers.The granary has been turned into a tea room with all the food being baked on the premises.
